lines.content: # Class files created for local testing
# MacOS custom attributes files created by Finder
* Fork this repo to your GitHub account and clone the fork to your computer
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first).
1. Set up the correct JDK version.
* Click `Configure` > `Structure for new Projects` (in older versions of Intellij:`Configure` > `Project Defaults` > `Project Structure`).
* If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11.
1. Locate the project directory and click `OK`.
1. Select `Create project from existing sources` and click `Next`.
1. Rename the project if you want. Click `Next`.
1. Ensure that your src folder is checked. Keep clicking `Next`.

`Level-10` | JavaFX tutorials:
→ [Part 1: Introduction to JavaFX][fx1]
→ [Part 2: Creating a GUI for duke.Duke][fx2]
→ [Part 3: Interacting with the user][fx3]
→ [Part 4: Introduction to FXML][fx4]
* If you have feedback or bug reports, please post in [se-edu/duke issue tracker](https://github.com/se-edu/duke/issues).

* The Deadline Class extends the Task Class to store objects with a description with a time and date attached
* Creates a Deadline object with a description and specific start and end time and date
* @param time start and end time and date
* Returns the type of the Task
public void echo(TaskList tasks, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("~Hello I am Eevee.~\n" + "~What can I do for you?~");
System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you again soon!");
* The Event Class extends the Task Class to store objects with a description with a time but no date attached
* Creates an Event object with a description and specific start and end time
* Returns the type of the Task
* The Lister Class parses commands and references TaskList and Storage Classes to store and retrieve Tasks
* Creates a Lister object to reference to TaskList and Storage objects
* @param storage initial storage with filepath to store data
* @param command input to identify relevant Task objects to create and their description

* The Main Class initialises all important objects for the program to run
* Creates a Main object from a filepath
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader( new FileReader(filePath));

* The Task Class is the parent class to ToDo, Deadline and Event Classes
* Creates a Task object with a description and time
* Converts boolean isDone to a tick or cross
* @return a tick or cross as a String
* Changes the boolean isDone to true
* Returns the type of the Task (ToDo, Event or Deadline)
* The ToDo Class extends the Task Class to store objects with a description but no time and date attached
* Creates a ToDo object with a description and empty time
* Returns the type of the Task
